context: The Estonian word 'pesu' has multiple related meanings: 1) The act of washing, as in 'going to wash'; 2) Laundry or washed clothes; 3) Underclothes or underwear; 4) Bedclothes. It can refer to the process of cleaning items like dishes, floors, windows, but most commonly refers to clothing that has been washed or needs to be washed. The word can also describe different types of underwear for men/women, children's underwear, seasonal underwear (summer/winter), and various materials like cotton silk bedclothing.
